Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

Strengthening Resistance to Infection

Select each flashcard to read more about the many actions that can be taken to Strengthen Resistance to Infection.

Healthful Nutrition

Healthful nutrition involves offering recommended types and portions of foods and breast milk to infants until they are 12 months old.

Getting Enough Sleep and Exercise

Children need to get the appropriate amount of sleep and exercise.

Choosing Safe Activities

Safe activities decrease exposure to injuries.

Following Healthful Practices

Healthful practices would include hand hygiene, cough and sneeze etiquette, and oral hygiene. A lot of germs are spread by hands that cover mouths during a cough or sneeze. It is better to use an elbow or arm to cover a cough but preferable to use a disposable tissue.

Care to Individuals with Special Needs

Children with special needs should have an individual plan of care that addresses their health issues.

Health Education

Health education assists providers in knowing best practices to follow.

Immunizations

Immunizations are a crucial way to strengthen resistance and will be discussed in the following slides. Of all of the interventions mentioned above, immunizations are the #1 way to strengthen resistance to infection.
